title: Fundamentals and Applications of 3D Human Motion Generation

context.prior_knowledge: Linear algebra, foundational machine learning, and basic understanding of 3D graphics
context.additional_context: Learners understand 3D motion generation principles through mathematical modeling and deep learning techniques, applying them to real data via projects. Practical exercises and collaboration are conducted using personal devices.

learning_goals: Learners can explain the core mathematical model (ADAM-Net) for 3D human motion generation.
Learners can implement motion transition generation techniques using random masking and attention mechanisms.
Learners can evaluate 3D pose/shape interpolation results between given 2D image sequences and suggest improvement strategies.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
